message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with cross-lingual adaptation, which is a subfield of natural language processing. The paper also mentions topic and sentiment classification, which are common tasks in the field of computational linguistics. 

It is also likely to belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the proposed method uses Structural Correspondence Learning (SCL), a machine learning algorithm for domain adaptation. 

The paper may also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the proposed method involves creating a cross-lingual representation that enables the transfer of classification knowledge, which is relevant to information retrieval tasks. 

Additionally, it may belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper proposes a method for transferring knowledge between languages, which is a common problem in the field of AI. 

Finally, it may belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as the proposed method involves creating cross-lingual feature correspondences, which is a common task in computer vision.
